Aquatic Cities: Cities would be built entirely underwater, with buildings and infrastructure designed to withstand the pressure and corrosive environment of the ocean floor.
Marine Exploration: The discovery of new species of fish and marine life would be accelerated, leading to a better understanding of the ocean's biodiversity and ecosystems.
Aquatic Agriculture: Aquafarming would become the primary source of food, as underwater farms would be built to cultivate crops and raise livestock.
Submarine Tourism: The tourism industry would boom, with underwater hotels and resorts becoming popular vacation destinations.
Underwater Transportation: Submarine trains and cars would be built to transport people and goods between cities and countries, reducing travel times and pollution.
